message.content:
<<<api>>>: String.getBytes()
<<<code>>>: 
```java
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.util.Enumeration;

import gnu.io.CommPortIdentifier;
import gnu.io.PortInUseException;
import gnu.io.SerialPort;
import gnu.io.UnsupportedCommOperationException;

public class SerialCommunicationExample {
    static Enumeration portList;
    static CommPortIdentifier portId;
    static String messageString = "at \n";
    static SerialPort serialPort;
    static OutputStream outputStream;

    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        portList = CommPortIdentifier.getPortIdentifiers();
        System.out.println("Trying to open serial port...");

        while (portList.hasMoreElements()) {
            portId = (CommPortIdentifier) portList.nextElement();
            if (portId.getPortType() == CommPortIdentifier.PORT_SERIAL) {
                if (portId.getName().equals("COM12")) {
                    try {
                        serialPort = (SerialPort) portId.open("SimpleWriteApp", 2000);
                    } catch (PortInUseException e) {
                        System.out.println("Error: Port is already in use.");
                    }
                    try {
                        outputStream = serialPort.getOutputStream();
                    } catch (IOException e) {
                        System.out.println("Error: Failed to get output stream.");
                    }
                    try {
                        serialPort.setSerialPortParams(9600, SerialPort.DATABITS_8, SerialPort.STOPBITS_1,
                                SerialPort.PARITY_NONE);
                    } catch (UnsupportedCommOperationException e) {
                        System.out.println("Error: Failed to set serial port parameters.");
                    }
                    outputStream.write(messageString.getBytes());
                    System.out.println("Sent AT command: " + messageString);
                    outputStream.close();
                    serialPort.close();
                    System.out.println("Serial port closed.");
                }
            }
        }
    }
}
```

<<<explanation>>>: The code you provided is almost correct. The issue seems to be with the error handling and the way you are printing error messages. I have made some modifications to the code to handle errors properly and added appropriate error messages. The code should now open the serial port, set the parameters, send the AT command, and close the serial port. Make sure you have the RXTX library installed and added to your project's classpath.
